thread.title: Palmetto Sunrise: Nikki Haley calls on public to help
thread.title_full: Palmetto Sunrise: Nikki Haley calls on public to help - Post and Courier

author: Cynthia Roldan
title: Palmetto Sunrise: Nikki Haley calls on public to help
text:
Gov. Nikki Haley helps clean up a home in Forest Acres. (Cynthia Roldan/Staff) × FOREST ACRES — Gov. Nikki Haley spent Thursday evening wearing gloves, goggles and a facemask.
The Palmetto State’s governor was in one of the Midlands’ most devastated areas, Forest Acres, to help clean up a World War II veteran’s home. It was part of an effort by Samaritan’s Purse, a faith-based organization that responds to disasters throughout the nation.
Haley called for South Carolinians to help their neighbors and promoted today’s Team South Carolina Day in Sumter. From 11 a.m., to 7 p.m., at the Sumter County Civic Center, 700 W. Liberty St., multiple agencies will be on hand to help those who were devastated by the flood. Haley, who will be at the event, has called for volunteers to attend as well.
